messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:15): looks like html5lib does not have test coverage for spec rev 1320
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:15): looks

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:16): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, actually, I did check changing the implied end tags stuff and several fragment tests started reporting different amount of errors
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:17): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I'd be more interested in catching the tree change arising from the different confidion for generate implied ond tags
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:18): but for some reason, it isn't quite obvious to me what the right test case would be
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:18): I don't think there's a difference for that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:18): I also did not look at the </form> change
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:19): oh. right. However, there does seem to be a difference with popping stuff
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:20): unless I'm missing something important
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:20): are you missing that <td> etc. never work in "in body"?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:20): I was missing something important
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:21): nothing to see here
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:21): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I was missing the details of me own stack search optimization
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:43): is it recommended to keep the table tainting data on the element stack or to keep a smaller separate taint stack?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:44): i would just toggle a bit on the element itself
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:45): i've done it on the element stock, as 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e said
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:45): that seems to work good for nested tables, etc.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:45): i hate the tainted stuff
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:45): but i didn't see another solution
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:46): but that causes excessive stack traversal, doesn't it?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:46): compared to constant-time inspection of the top of a taint stack
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:47): your idea would require making sure the taint stack is always correct
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:47): which might be tricky with nested tables
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:47): <table>X<tr><td><table></table></td> </table>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:47): that depends on how many different cases there are where a table comes off the stack
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:48): that becomes "X <table>..." iirc
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:48): though spaces in the inner <table> should not be moved
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:48): oh you really mean how do you keep track fo the "current table"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:48): and the answer is, yeah, optimise it to a separate stack
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:49): i believe you can only pop a table using <table> or </table>, but i may be wrong
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:49): that could work, yes
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:49): hmm. let's see if an unoptimized impl. is good enough
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:49): not done in our python impl
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:50): hmm, two implementations not doing namespaces in the Selectors API so far...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:50): hixie might have been on to something :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:52): btw i think you may have been onto something with dropping multiple views
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:52): if you want support for that, i'm happy to give it to you
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:52): i currently specced it, deferring definitions of "view" and "default view" to HTML 5 :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:53): hah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:00): bed time
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (14:00): nn
